H0.text: Food and soil are taken away from a forest by a fire that squirrels need to survive.

H1.text: Food and shelter are what a fire takes away from a forest that squirrels need to survive.

H2.text: Water and soil are what a fire takes away from a forest that squirrels need to survive.

H3.text: Water and shelter are what a fire takes away from a forest that squirrels need to survive.

A4.text: Fire helps to return nutrients from plant matter back to the soil.

A5.text: The heat from fire is necessary to the germination of certain types of seeds.

A6.text: Mild to moderate fires burn in the forest understory, removing small trees and herbaceous groundcover.
